description: From Ancient Greek προξενία (proxenía) derived from πρόξενος (próxenos).

entries.meaning: (historical) In Ancient Greece, an arrangement whereby a citizen (chosen by the city) hosted foreign ambassadors at his own expense, in return for honorary titles from the state.
examples: If there be near me now a man of the Achaians who dwelleth far up the Ionian sea, he shall not upbraid me: I have faith in my proxeny  […]
